articleContent.title: Chord: Major in F (Shape: D)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: Major in F (Shape: D)

## Brief Description
The Major chord in the key of F played in the shape of D is a common chord voicing used in many musical styles. It consists of three notes - F, A, and C - played together to create a harmonious sound. This chord has a bright and uplifting quality that can evoke feelings of happiness and positivity.

## Notes and Intervals
- F (Root)
- A (Major Third)
- C (Perfect Fifth)

## Musical Flavor
The Major chord in F played in the shape of D is often used in pop, rock, and folk music to add a sense of resolution and stability to a song. It has a warm and full sound that can help create an emotional connection with the listener. When played in the context of a song, this chord can provide a sense of closure or a feeling of contentment.

## Songs
1. "Hey Jude" by The Beatles
2. "I'm Yours" by Jason Mraz
3. "Stand By Me" by Ben E. King
